data.title: Clone the Bitmap in ImageEx.RGBToBGR()
data.body:
This prevents the call to Clear() from clearing the source when it should only have been clearing the target.

Fixes #1946

data.title: Fix DX template (wrong .NET Framework version)
data.body:
Fix Android build SDK version.
Make all VS templates consistent.
- Same output directories (csproj and mgcb).
- Same Game1.cs (with only a few minor platform differences)

data.title: Added FAQ information
data.body: Copied the FAQ information from the wiki and added it to the new docs.

data.title: Font Rendering is broken on iOS

data.title: Make GameWindow a partial class instead of abstract class
data.body:
Long story short:

1) We could add perplatform stuff more easily without having to resort to:
https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/blob/develop/MonoGame.Framework/GameWindow.cs#L26
2) Why is there an AllowUserResizing property on Android? Ok, we are keeping that for XNA compatibility, but still, does make a point, we could potentially disable stuff that doesn't work on specific platforms.

CC. @dellis1972 @KonajuGames @tomspilman

data.title: DX version keeps the game running after Exit()
data.body:
The stable 3.4 version keeps the game running in background after performing Exit() or by closing the windows. If you add a breakpoint on the Exit() and skip it, the game will stop after a while.
It occurs even in a new empty solution.

I have tried the daily build but this version seems broken as the windows.xna.framework seems unreachable...

Feel free to ask me more details.
Thanks ans regards.

data.title: Rgba64 support in PixelBitmapContent
data.body:
- Added other packed vector types that had been omitted, though I'm not sure how to support NormalizedShort2 and 4 as there does not appear to be corresponding SurfaceFormat types.
- Updated Rgba64 importer test to expect SurfaceFormat.Rgba64.

data.title: Add Graphics Debugging Event/Marker System
data.body:
We should add an API which can be extended for different platforms to provide graphics markers for various graphics debuggers like PIX, nvPerfHud, [gDEBugger](http://www.gremedy.com/products.php), or proprietary tools on consoles.

The API should consist of some begin/end event and marker calls that can be disabled programmatically and/or at compile time.  Possibly similar to this:

 https://github.com/sharpdx/SharpDX/blob/master/Source/SharpDX.Desktop/Direct3D/PixHelper.cs

It should be implemented with partial methods implemented platform specific files so that some platforms can implement them and others can ignore them if unsupported.

The feature should include some documentation on how they work in both reference docs and a article discussing how and when to use them along with examples of usage.

data.title: Implementation of SetTitle for UWP
data.body:
Sets the title for the current view for Universal Windows Project apps.
It should be noted that this is meant to be the title for the current
view, and that UWP apps always will append the Display Name from the app
manifest to this title.

data.title: Write explination/defense of the Content Pipeline
data.body:
We really need to add a section to the MonoGame docs explaining what the content pipeline is, why it is important, and answers to frequently asked questions about it.  This issue comes up a lot and we need a standard place to point people at.

It would be linked to here:

http://www.monogame.net/documentation/?page=Adding_Art_Sounds_and_More

And would be specifically aimed at explaining and to some extent defending the use of content compiled before runtime.

It should not be detailing the inner workings of the pipeline like this:

https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/bb447745.aspx

It should focus entirely on why the content pipeline exists and why it is better than loading PNGs or WAVs at runtime.

data.title: Legacy Content in Windows GL Throwing Error
data.body:
I have a spritfont file that was compiled using the old MonoGame content builder project from long ago. This spritefont file works fine in the DX version of MonoGame but crashes the GL version. The GL version complains about an invalid type argument:

Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.MonoGameGLException: GL.GetError() returned InvalidValue
   at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.GraphicsExtensions.CheckGLError() in C:\github\cocos2d-xna\MonoGame\MonoGame.Framework\Graphics\GraphicsExtensions.cs:line 918
   at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.Texture2D.<>c__DisplayClass35_0`1.<PlatformSetData>b__0() in C:\github\cocos2d-xna\MonoGame\MonoGame.Framework\Graphics\Texture2D.OpenGL.cs:line 192

Line 192 is the second GL.CompressedTexImage2D call in the following:

```
                if (glFormat == (GLPixelFormat)All.CompressedTextureFormats)
                {
                    if (rect.HasValue)
                    {
                        GL.CompressedTexSubImage2D(TextureTarget.Texture2D, level, x, y, w, h, glFormat, data.Length - startBytes, dataPtr);
                        GraphicsExtensions.CheckGLError();
                    }
                    else
                    {
                        GL.CompressedTexImage2D(TextureTarget.Texture2D, level, glInternalFormat, w, h, 0, data.Length - startBytes, dataPtr);
                        GraphicsExtensions.CheckGLError();
                    }
                }
```

glInternalFormat = CompressedRgbaS3tcDxt3Ext

Here are all of the GL caps for the card I am using:

data.title: Window.Title has no effect in a UWP project
data.body:
Setting of Window.Title in e.g. the Initialize method has no effect in a Universal Windows project.
It does work though in a Windows OpenGL project, so I reckon it has to do with the UWP SDK.

So steps to reproduce:
1. Open Visual Studio
2. Create new project choosing "MonoGame Windows 10 Universal Project"
3. In Game1.Initialize set Window.Title to "My Title";
4. Run the app, and we expect the window title to be "My Title" while it is in fact still the project title.

data.title: Fix an issue where the Symlink for MonoGame was NOT created
data.body:
Fix an issue where the Symlink for MonoGame was NOT created in

 /Library/Frameworks/Mono.framework/External/xbuild

because the directory did not exist.

data.title: Add exception to PixelBitmapContent constructor
data.body:
If the call to TryGetFormat returns false inside the constructor, throw
an InvalidOperationException instead of continuing with the wrong
SurfaceFormat.
This bug was detected in #4595: If for the T parameter of `PixelBitmapContent` there is no matching `SurfaceFormat` the constructor defaults to `SurfaceFormat.Color` and continues like nothing has happened, leading to problems when using this instance

data.title: Fix for importing RGBA16 bitmap
data.body:
Fixes #4592.
This is the simplest fix for the problem, convert the bitmap to 32 bits and continue from there.
Future bitmaps that are not contemplated in the special cases are treated as bitmaps, and converted to 32 bits bitmaps.
I have tried to preserve the higher color resolution of the original image, but `PixelBitmapContent.TryGetFormat` can't handle that option at this time, and this exposed a bug in `PixelBitmapContent.SetPixelData` it ignores the return value of `TryGetFormat`, using the default value.

In game test of the texture, it is a bit cropped at bottom because the window ended there
![ingametex](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11319966/13477629/a357d026-e0cd-11e5-8215-df5ae4fc30fa.PNG)

This can be merged now, or I can try to enable the RGBA64 format later

data.title: Add ImageMagick processor so some other image types can be processed
data.body:
I wanted to talk about this for a while, but always seemed to forget. How about we start using "ImageMagick" for reading images for content Pipeline.

Why? Supported formats for one, which include both Gimp(XCF) and Photoshop(PSD) formats:
http://www.imagemagick.org/script/formats.php

It also has a .NET wrapper: https://magick.codeplex.com/

Worst case scenario if we can't actually use it as a replacement for our current method, we could still make it convert the file to some known format for us. I've only ever used it as a linux terminal command.

CC. @tomspilman @KonajuGames @dellis1972

data.title: Metal Support for iOS

milestone.title: 4.0 Release
milestone.description: Major new API to support the new graphics libraries like Metal, Vulkan, and DirectX 12.

data.body:
This is an offspring of the discussion in https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/issues/4571.

We need to implement a new Metal backend for iOS devices under our existing XNA style API.  The tasks would include:
- Fix 2MGFX to support Metal shaders.
- Document how to write a Metal FX file.
- Port the stock effect FX files to Metal.
- Add our own bindings for just the Metal APIs we use (like we are for OGL, SDL, OAL).
- Implement a new graphics backend for Metal.
- Remove old OpenGL iOS code.
- Test on a bunch of new and old iOS devices.

data.title: Pipeline (3.5.x, under Mac) failing for 16 bit PNG files.
data.body:
Check the file in attach.
I get 

```
/Users/ambs/Desktop/Aulas/2015-2016/TDJ/Sokoban/Sokoban/Content/Character.png
/Users/ambs/Desktop/Aulas/2015-2016/TDJ/Sokoban/Sokoban/Content/Character.png: error: Importer 'TextureImporter' had unexpected failure!
System.NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object
  at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.TextureImporter.Import (System.String filename, Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.ContentImporterContext context) <0x3079168 + 0x00459> in <filename unknown>:0 
  at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.ContentImporter`1[T].Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.IContentImporter.Import (System.String filename, Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.ContentImporterContext context) <0x30790d0 + 0x0002e> in <filename unknown>:0 
  at MonoGame.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Builder.PipelineManager.ProcessContent (MonoGame.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Builder.PipelineBuildEvent pipelineEvent) <0x3078818 + 0x000f7> in <filename unknown>:0 
```

![character](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/118547/13470848/df040130-e0a5-11e5-9b2a-73cc007ec45e.png)

data.title: Issues converting a WindowsDX project to DesktopGL
data.body:
I am trying to convert a project I did in XNA, that I have converted to WindowsDX succesfully, but now when trying to use DesktopGL, while it compiles without changing anything in the code, i'm having the following problems (using latest development installer):
- First try to run the game showed that the `OpenAL` installer is included with the installer but not run.
- If content is set for Windows platform or DesktopGL I get a `InvalidDataException` from NVorbis.dll with message "Could not determine container type!"
- If content is set for DesktopGL it fails to compile a mp3 file with the "lame" codec (it's a different file from the one of the previous post), the other mp3 files work

data.body:
This should make porting to other platforms easier.
Also implemented the GetAssets/GetFiles functionality

data.title: Added Rider Support to Linux installer

milestone.title: 3.6 Release
milestone.description: More unit tests, running unit tests on Mac and Linux, SDL2 replacing OpenTK.

data.title: ffmpeg quality value not working on Mac
data.body:
Hi

I can't test this in other arch at the moment. But using full quality on Pipeline doesn't work to create a ogg file (libvorbis).

As far as I could tell, this is the default call to ffmpeg on Mac:

```
ffmpeg -y -i input.mp3 -vn -c:a libvorbis -b:a 192000 -f:a ogg -strict experimental output.ogg
```

I kept trying to find a suitable bitrate, and the higher i could find was 180k

```
ffmpeg -y -i input.mp3 -vn -c:a libvorbis -b:a 180000 -f:a ogg -strict experimental output.ogg
```

So, probably better to check if this happens with othr versions, and probably adapt `QualityToBitRate` function to return different values accordingly with encoder. Even not being able to compile, I can try to create a patch.

Using the .xnb file generated when creating a Mac m4a, and the .ogg file created above, I still get

```
Failed to get buffer bits: Invalid Value, format=Stereo16, size=0, sampleRate=22050
```

Let me know how/if I can help debugging this.
Best,
Alberto

data.title: Add Vector3.TransformCoord
data.body: Add Vector3.TransformCoord that does the same as XMVector3TransformCoord by mapping the result back to w = 1.  Documentation to be clear about its behaviour.

data.title: Update documentation for Vector3.Transform
data.body: The documentation for Vector3.Transform to be updated to include clarification that it ignores the w component.  This is intended behaviour and needs to be made clear to the user.

data.title: [MG Framework] Make CurrentPlatform public
Upgrade Xamarin Studio Addin for Version 6.0
data.body: This is the Update for Xamarin Studio 6.0. It is currently in Alpha so this should NOT be merged until it hits stable. However I will try to keep this branch update to develop so Xamarin Studio 6.0 users can use the build artifacts

data.title: The Xamarin Studio Roslyn Preview makes MonoGame unusable.
data.body:
When downloading the latest development version of MonoGame, it checks for MonoDevelop.Core v5.0 and MonoDevelop.Ide v5.0, but I use the [Preview Release: Xamarin Studio 6.0 with Roslyn Support](https://forums.xamarin.com/discussion/53121/preview-release-xamarin-studio-6-0-with-roslyn-support), which uses MonoDevelop.Core v6.0 and MonoDevelop.Ide v5.0. [This is my Add-in Manager.](http://imgur.com/B3etDsG)
I don't want to install 2 instances of Xamarin Studio just for developing XNA.
Is there a solution to this?

Thanks in advance.

data.title: Visual Studio iOS template
data.body: Fixes #4562

data.title: Fix Mac Installer to place the OSX assemblies in the correct location.
data.body:
They should have been installing to 'MacOSX' rather than 'MacOS'
because 'MacOSX' is what we use to describe the platform.

data.title: OSX Installer is installing OSX assemblies to MacOS instead of MacOSX
data.body: We currently have a "MacOSX" platform. For the most part when we create the assemblies folder it matches the platform. This is not the case for MacOSX  the assemblies go into the MacOS folder.
